article.headline: Virginia Commonwealth 75, George Mason 62
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP) -- B.A. Walker scored 24 points and Virginia Commonwealth used a 3-point shooting barrage in the second half to beat George Mason 75-62 Wednesday night. Walker hit four of Virginia Commonwealth's eight second-half 3-pointers, as the Rams (17-3, 9-0 Colonial Athletic Association) outscored the Patriots 44-32 after halftime. George Mason (11-8, 5-4) hit just 5 of 17 from behind the arc for the game. Jamal Shuler scored 17 points for the Rams, who won their eighth straight and are 9-0 in the CAA for the first time. Folarin Campbell had 19 points and a career-high nine rebounds and Will Thomas added 14 points for George Mason. Shuler put the Rams up for good, 29-28, on a 3-pointer with 58 seconds remaining in the first half. The Rams took control with a 13-5 run early in the second half that extended their lead to 53-44.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
